title: Add a QMakePackage base class
body:
This PR adds Spack support for the qmake build system.

Unfortunately, I'm not able to test this. I am unable to install `qt` on macOS (see #2363 and #2496) or on CentOS 6. I even tried using `qt` built with Anaconda but that didn't work either. There are a few things that I would like to see tested before this is merged:

1. ~Do these packages need `qt` as a build/link dependency or just build? Run `ldd -r` on any dynamic executables or shared libraries to confirm.~ Pretty sure it is a link dependency too.
2. ~Are these packages actually using Spack's compiler wrappers? Add `echo "USING SPACK'S COMPILER WRAPPERS"` to `lib/spack/env/cc` to confirm. There are a few [qmake variables](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qmake-variable-reference.html) that can be set including `QMAKE_CC` and `QMAKE_CXX`, as well as some RPATH-related variables that could be set.~ The compiler wrappers are being used.
3. ~Do packages built with `qmake` come with any build-time or install-time tests? Check the generated Makefile for targets like `check` or `test`.~ Found one with a `check:` target.

@jrood-nrel added the `qwt` package in #4911, while @lee218llnl added the `qt-creator` package in #1659. Would either of you be willing to test this, or tell me your secret for getting `qt` installed?
